Description: An introduction to the Italian language in the context of Italian culture.
A continuation of the introduction to the Italian language in the context of Italian culture.

Exposure to basic grammar and to current Italian useful to travelers. Not applicable to fulfillment of foreign
 language requirement.

Continuation of ITAL 15204.
Continued development of speaking, listening, reading and writing skills using a variety of cultural materials.

Study and practice of written and oral Italian with emphasis on acquisition of written and oral proficiency in the
 language.
Advanced practice in speaking and writing the Italian language.

This course surveys the major movements and authors from the Baroque period through the 20th century.
Lectures, readings, oral and written reports on outstanding features of the culture and civilization of Italy.

(Repeatable for credit)Variable topic course deals with single literary theme in Italian literature or a single
 author. May be offered in Italian or in English translation.

(Repeatable for credit)Workshops individually designed to provide instruction and training in specific areas of
 Italian studies. S u graded.

Prerequisites: ITAL 25202 and junior standing and special approval.
Description:
(Repeatable for a total of 6 credit hours)Allows the advanced, serious student to carry out research study
 project on Italian literature, language or culture. Prior approval of supervising faculty member department
 required.
